page.title: 02DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: This area is situated approximately 2 miles north-east of Crieff. The highest point is Milquanzie Hill(1000 ft) and the lowest point is southern most in the area where the main population centre is situated. It is a hilly area with the main road (A85) running towards Perth through the south of the area. Another road leaves the main road in Gilmerton and runs up the Sma' Glen through Monzie to Dunkeld. Both deciduous and coniferous forestry is present but the majority of the land is used for farming. Loch Meallbrodden is found in the north-east corner of the area surrounded by forestry and moorland.
